comments:
Currently the UI cannot handle the case when there are extremely long method
names  in the trace. 

Try Import->Profiling File (with the attached file), with Show full data
selected. When you click on Finish, the progress indicator will go to the end of
the line, a new entry will be added to the profiling monitor, but the import
dialog will not go away (the way it should). When you click cancel and look at
the entry that was added, I've had one of two things happen: A dialog pop up
telling me that an error has occurred and that I should look at the error log;
or, I can see the method listed in the method stats view, but the entry for
'executeQuery' is truncated (compare it against what's in the xml file -- you
will see that the method name is longer there).
Created an attachment (id=16439)
xml file for importing
This bug is the UI code and is triggered by this option:

<option key="org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.type0"
value="com.ibm.rpa.internal.launching.j2eeProfilingType"/>

If you remove this option the data shows up correctly.

Here is the exception:

The NullPointerException is fixed. When the UI encounters unknown profiling 
types, it will ignore them. However, the full string is still not being 
displayed in the table. It appears to be a limitation of the UI widget itself - 
the full string is present in the model and is being sent in the 
TableItem.setText().

Long method names will be handled in bug 80440. Rather than trying to show them 
in the table cells, they will be shown via better tooltip pop-ups (multi-line), 
similar to the java editor.
